==Events==
*[[671]] &ndash; Emperor [[Emperor Tenji|Tenji]] of [[Japan]] introduces a water clock ([[water clock|clepsydra]]) called ''Rokoku''. The instrument, which measure time and indicates hours, is placed in the capital of [[Ōtsu, Shiga|Ōtsu]].
*[[1190]] &ndash; [[Third Crusade]]: [[Frederick I, Holy Roman Emperor|Frederick I Barbarossa]] drowns in the river [[Göksu|Saleph]] while leading an army to [[Jerusalem]].
*[[1329]] &ndash; The [[Battle of Pelekanon]] results in a [[Byzantine Empire|Byzantine]] defeat by the [[Ottoman Empire]].
*[[1523]] &ndash; [[Copenhagen]] is surrounded by the army of [[Frederick I of Denmark]], as the city won't recognise him as the successor of [[Christian II of Denmark]].
*[[1539]] &ndash; [[Council of Trent]]: [[Paul III]] sends out letters to his [[bishop]]s, delaying the Council due to war and the difficulty bishops had traveling to [[Venice]].
*[[1619]] &ndash; [[Thirty Years' War]]: [[Battle of Záblatí]], a turning point in the [[Thirty Years' War#The Bohemian Revolt|Bohemian Revolt]].
*[[1624]] &ndash; Signing of the [[Treaty of Compiègne (1624)|Treaty of Compiègne]] between [[France]] and the [[Netherlands]].
*[[1692]] &ndash; [[Salem witch trials]]: [[Bridget Bishop]] is hanged at Gallows Hill near [[Salem, Massachusetts]], for "certaine Detestable Arts called Witchcraft & Sorceries".
*[[1719]] &ndash; [[Jacobite Rising]]: [[Battle of Glen Shiel]].
*[[1786]] &ndash; A [[landslide dam]] on the [[Dadu River (China)|Dadu River]] created by an earthquake ten days earlier collapses, killing 100,000 in the [[Sichuan]] province of [[China]].
*[[1793]] &ndash; The [[Jardin des Plantes]] museum opens in [[Paris]]. A year later, it becomes the first public [[zoo]].
*  1793   &ndash; [[French Revolution]]: Following the arrests of [[Girondin]] leaders, the [[Jacobin Club|Jacobins]] gain control of the [[Committee of Public Safety]] installing the ''[[Reign of Terror|revolutionary dictatorship]]''.
*[[1805]] &ndash; [[First Barbary War]]: [[Yusuf Karamanli]] signs a treaty ending the hostilities between [[Tripolitania]] and the [[United States]].
*[[1829]] &ndash; The first [[The Boat Race|Boat Race]] between the [[University of Oxford]] and the [[University of Cambridge]] takes place.
*[[1838]] &ndash; [[Myall Creek massacre]]: Twenty-eight [[Aboriginal Australian]]s are murdered.
*[[1854]] &ndash; The first class of [[United States Naval Academy]] students graduate.
*[[1861]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]]: [[Battle of Big Bethel]] - [[Confederate States of America|Confederate]] troops under [[John B. Magruder]] defeat a much larger [[Union (American Civil War)|Union]] force led by General [[Ebenezer W. Pierce]] in [[Virginia]].
*[[1864]] &ndash; American Civil War: [[Battle of Brice's Crossroads]] - Confederate troops under [[Nathan Bedford Forrest]] defeat a much larger Union force led by General [[Samuel D. Sturgis]] in [[Mississippi]].
*[[1871]] &ndash; [[Sinmiyangyo]]: Captain McLane Tilton leads 109 [[United States Marine Corps|US Marines]] in a naval attack on [[Han River (Korea)|Han River]] forts on [[Kanghwa Island]], [[Korea]].
*[[1878]] &ndash; [[League of Prizren]] is established, to oppose the decisions of the [[Congress of Berlin]] and the [[Treaty of San Stephano]], as a consequence of which the Albanian lands in [[Balkans]] were being partitioned and given to the neighbor states of [[Serbia]], [[Montenegro]], [[Bulgaria]] and [[Greece]].
*[[1886]] &ndash; [[Mount Tarawera]] in [[New Zealand]] erupts, killing 153 people and destroying the famous [[Pink and White Terraces]].
*[[1898]] &ndash; [[Spanish–American War]]: [[United States Marine Corps|U.S. Marines]] land on the island of [[Cuba]].
*[[1912]] &ndash; The [[Villisca Axe Murders]] were discovered in [[Villisca, Iowa]].
*[[1916]] &ndash; An [[Arab Revolt]] against the [[Ottoman Empire]] led by [[T.E. Lawrence|Lawrence of Arabia]] breaks out.
*[[1918]] &ndash; The [[Austro-Hungarian Navy|Austro-Hungarian]] battleship {{Ship|SMS|Szent István}} sinks off the [[Croatia]]n coast after being torpedoed by an [[Kingdom of Italy|Italian]] [[MAS (ships)|MAS]] motorboat; the event is recorded by camera from a nearby vessel.
*[[1924]] &ndash; [[Fascist]]s kidnap and kill Italian [[Socialism|Socialist]] leader [[Giacomo Matteotti]] in [[Rome]].
*[[1925]] &ndash; Inaugural service for the [[United Church of Canada]], a union of [[Presbyterian]], [[Methodist]], and [[Congregational church|Congregationalist]] churches, held in the [[Mutual Street Arena|Toronto Arena]].
*[[1935]] &ndash; Dr. [[Bob Smith (doctor)|Robert Smith]] takes his last drink, and [[Alcoholics Anonymous]] is founded in [[Akron, Ohio|Akron]], [[Ohio]], [[United States]], by him and [[Bill W.|Bill Wilson]].
*  1935   &ndash; [[Chaco War]] ends: a truce is called between [[Bolivia]] and [[Paraguay]] who had been fighting since [[1932]].
*[[1936]] &ndash; The Russian animation studio [[Soyuzmultfilm]] is founded.
*[[1940]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: [[President of the United States|U.S. President]] [[Franklin D. Roosevelt]] denounces Italy's actions with his "Stab in the Back" speech at the graduation ceremonies of the [[University of Virginia]].
*  1940   &ndash; World War II: [[Norway]] surrenders to [[Nazi Germany|German]] forces.
*  1940   &ndash; World War II: Italy declares war on France and the United Kingdom.
*[[1942]] &ndash; World War II: [[Nazism|Nazis]] burn the [[Czech Republic|Czech]] village of [[Lidice]] in reprisal for the killing of [[Reinhard Heydrich]].
*[[1944]] &ndash; World War II: Six hundred forty-two men, women and children are killed in the [[Oradour-sur-Glane]] Massacre in France.
*  1944   &ndash; World War II: In [[Distomo]], [[Boeotia]], [[Greece]] 218 men, women and children are [[Distomo massacre|massacred by German troops]].
*  1944   &ndash; In [[baseball]], 15-year old [[Joe Nuxhall]] of the [[Cincinnati Reds]] becomes the youngest player ever in a major-league game.
*[[1945]] &ndash; [[Second Australian Imperial Force|Australian Imperial Forces]] land in [[Brunei Bay]] to liberate [[Brunei]].
*[[1947]] &ndash; [[Saab Automobile|Saab]] produces its first [[automobile]].
*[[1957]] &ndash; [[John Diefenbaker]] leads the [[Progressive Conservative Party of Canada]] to a stunning upset in the [[Canadian federal election, 1957]], ending 22 years of [[Liberal Party of Canada|Liberal Party]] government.
*[[1963]] &ndash; [[Equal Pay Act of 1963]] aimed at abolishing [[wage]] disparity based on sex (see [[Gender pay gap]]). It was signed into law on June 10, 1963 by [[John F. Kennedy]] as part of his [[New Frontier]] Program
*[[1967]] &ndash; The [[Six-Day War]] ends: [[Israel]] and [[Syria]] agree to a cease-fire.
*  1967   &ndash; [[Argentina]] becomes a member of the [[Berne Convention for the Protection of Literary and Artistic Works|Berne Convention]] [[copyright]] [[treaty]].
*[[1977]] &ndash; [[James Earl Ray]] escapes from [[Brushy Mountain State Prison]] in [[Petros, Tennessee]], but is recaptured on [[June 13]].
*  1977   &ndash; The [[Apple II]], one of the first [[personal computers]], goes on sale.
*[[1980]] &ndash; The [[African National Congress]] in [[South Africa]] publishes a call to fight from their imprisoned leader [[Nelson Mandela]].
*[[1990]] &ndash; [[British Airways Flight 5390]] lands safely at [[Southampton Airport]] after a blowout in the cockpit causes the captain to be partially sucked from the cockpit. There are no fatalities
* [[1991]] – Eleven-year-old [[Jaycee Lee Dugard]] was kidnapped in [[South Lake Tahoe, California]]; she would remain a captive until 2009.
*[[1996]] &ndash; Peace talks begin in [[Northern Ireland]] without the participation of [[Sinn Féin]].
*[[1997]] &ndash; Before fleeing his northern stronghold, [[Khmer Rouge]] leader [[Pol Pot]] orders the killing of his defense chief [[Son Sen]] and 11 of Sen's family members.
*[[1999]] &ndash; [[Kosovo War]]: [[NATO]] suspends its [[air strike]]s after [[Slobodan Milošević]] agrees to withdraw [[Serbia]]n forces from [[Kosovo]].
*[[2001]] &ndash; [[Pope John Paul II]] canonizes [[Lebanon]]'s first female saint, [[Saint Rafqa]].
*[[2002]] &ndash; The first direct electronic communication experiment between the nervous systems of two humans is carried out by [[Kevin Warwick]] in the United Kingdom.
*[[2003]] &ndash; The [[Spirit Rover]] is launched, beginning [[NASA]]'s [[Mars Exploration Rover]] mission.
